intro: Raphanus segetum, commonly known as the field radish, is an annual herbaceous plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and large, pinnately lobed leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in racemose inflorescences, which are followed by long, slender pods containing several seeds. Raphanus segetum is native to Europe and Asia and is often found in disturbed soils along roadsides and fields. It has a taproot that can become quite large, sometimes reaching several centimeters in diameter.
